content.instruction: Click on the 'hot spots' to view additional information.

activity.text:
Module 1: Math




  • Metric System
  • Percentages
  • Scientific Notation
  • Dimensional Analysis
  • Word Problems

hotspots.hotspot:
Metric System

You will learn what the metric system is and how it will be used in your Environmental Science course. You will use metric units during laboratory experiments and they may appear in multiple-choice and free-response questions on the AP Exam.

Percentages

Here you will be given step-by-step instruction on how to find a percent of a whole as well as how to find the part of the whole if given the percent. You will also be given instruction on how to find change in percent, an important skill for Environmental Science.

Scientific Notation

Scientific notation allows for easier recording of very large and very small numbers. By the end of this submodule you will be able to convert numbers from standard notation to scientific notation.

Dimensional Analysis

This math skill provides strategies for solving problems with different units.

Word Problem

Word problems fluster most. This submodule will provide problem solving strategies to make solving easier.

multiple.question: Which of the following countries has both the highest cultural diversity and the highest biological diversity of the countries listed in the diagram?

scene.matchingInstructions: Match the items on the left to the correct areas on the right.

drops.drop: All the organisms and the nonliving components found in a particular place.
An organism that depends on other organisms for its food.
An organism that makes its own food.
The different forms of a characteristic.
The process by which living things change over time.

scene.instructions: When you are done, check your results by clicking 'Check Answers'.

multiple.question: AP Environmental Science encompasses a wide scope of topics including biology, chemistry, physics, earth science, and the social sciences by integrating history, economics, and politics.
The AP Environmental Science Exam is given each year in June.
There are 8 modules in On Board for Environmental Science.
Data Analysis is an important skill need to achieve success in AP Environmental Science.
You may receive college credit if you perform well on the AP Exam.
